job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Snoqualmie, WA
pros: Good working environment for the most part.
cons: Perhaps more educational opportunities and choice of scheduling work days.

pros: Friendly staff, especially the social workers. Even the housekeepers were sweet and caring. Cannot say enough good things.
cons: I wish all hospitals were exactly like this one.

pros: nice coworkers, decent pay, good hours
cons: gossiping coworkers, favoritism, manager refuses to address concerns

pros: This is the best team of people I have ever work with. The culture is one of openness and encourages reporting of both positive and negative workplace conditions. Nearly everyone contributes to a sense of pride in being able to provided excellent patient care.
cons: This is a small hospital and with it comes financial constraints.

job_title: Administrative Director of ER and Inpatient in Snoqualmie, WA
pros: Proactive, positive, leading edge and progressive hospital district.  Good staff and competent leadership.  Good compensation for the area and size of the hospital.
cons: High level of stress.  Leadership is not very transparent.  Many decisions are made behind closed doors.

pros: Small setting and flexible schedule; no pharmacy technician, so get to learn every aspects in Pharmacy, from mixing IVs, TPNs, dosing, to purchasing supplies.
cons: Small setting, limited opportunities in clinical-related work

pros: Workload is decent and benefits are good.

job_title: Medical and Clinical Laboratory Technologist in Snoqualmie, WA
pros: Flexible schedule-if you are a friend of the manager
cons: your success and or failure is dependent on whether or not you spend time with managers outside of work time.
